file_operations.description: Create documentation page explaining dynamic page implementations. Cover Homepage (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) with HeroSection using frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x800.png, FeaturedToolsGrid, CategoryCards, PopularToolsByCategory, NewToolsSection, and Sidebar components. Explain Tool pages using ToolPageTemplate (frontend/src/pages/tools/ToolPageTemplate.tsx) with tool-specific gradient heroes (e.g., frontend/public/assets/generated/tool-percentage-calculator-hero-gradient.dim_1200x400.png), AboutTheTool, UsabilityGuide, FAQs, and related tools sidebar. Detail Dashboard (frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx) requiring authentication via useInternetIdentity, displaying user profile from getCallerUserProfile, credit balance using useCredits hook, and favorite tools. Cover Admin pages (frontend/src/pages/admin/) with AdminAuthGuard wrapper using AdminAuthContext, hardcoded admin authentication, and various management interfaces (Dashboard, CreditManagement, ToolManagement, etc.). Include component hierarchy diagrams and data fetching patterns using React Query hooks from frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts. Provide code examples showing routing patterns, authentication guards, and state management.

file_operations.description: Create comprehensive technology stack documentation. Cover Motoko backend with single-actor architecture in backend/main.mo, stable variables for data persistence, and public shared/query functions. Explain React frontend with functional components, hooks, and TypeScript. Document Tailwind CSS styling with OKLCH color system in frontend/src/index.css and custom theme configuration in frontend/tailwind.config.js. Detail Shadcn UI components from frontend/src/components/ui/ including Card, Button, Input, and their immutability constraint. Cover React Query for data fetching with useActor hook (frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts) creating backend actor instances, useQueries hooks for profiles/favorites/preferences, and automatic cache invalidation. Explain Three.js capabilities for 3D visualizations (if applicable to tools). Document Internet Identity authentication using useInternetIdentity hook (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts) with AuthClient, login/logout flows, and principal-based identity management. Include architecture diagram showing frontend-backend integration flow: React components → React Query hooks → useActor → Motoko actor methods → backend stable storage. Embed frontend/public/assets/generated/architecture-diagram.dim_1200x800.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/architecture-data-flow.dim_1200x800.png. Provide code examples demonstrating: actor instantiation, query/mutation patterns with React Query, Tailwind utility classes, shadcn/ui component usage, and Internet Identity integration. Explain technology selection rationale for each choice.

requirements.summary: Create comprehensive documentation page for Credit System covering complete architecture from backend to frontend with migration strategy
acceptanceCriteria: Documentation page accessible at /documentation/credit-system route
Explains backend credit data model with code from main.mo
Documents stable variables used for credit persistence
Covers useCredits hook implementation and React Query integration
Details credit consumption flow with sequence diagrams
Explains admin credit management interface
Includes migration considerations for credit schema changes

file_operations.description: Create comprehensive credit system documentation covering both frontend and backend aspects. Document backend implementation referencing the UserProfile type with totalCreditsAllowed and creditsConsumed fields, UserCreditStatus type for admin views, and backend functions: getCreditBalance, consumeCredits, updateProfileCredits, and listAllCreditBalances. Explain stable variable persistence patterns in the backend for credit data. Cover frontend implementation with useCredits hook (frontend/src/hooks/useCredits.ts) providing useGetCreditBalance, useConsumeCredits, useListAllCreditBalances, and useUpdateProfileCredits mutations with React Query integration and automatic cache invalidation. Detail credit consumption flow: user initiates action → frontend calls useConsumeCredits mutation → backend consumeCredits method validates balance → deducts credits from creditsConsumed → returns success/failure → frontend updates UI and query cache. Explain admin credit management interface in frontend/src/pages/admin/CreditManagement.tsx showing all user balances in sortable table with summary cards and manual credit adjustment using updateProfileCredits. Include sequence diagram showing complete credit flow from signup (initial totalCreditsAllowed) through consumption to balance checking. Document migration considerations when modifying credit schema: stable variable updates, data transformation functions, and backward compatibility. Provide code examples from backend interface (frontend/src/backend.d.ts) showing UserCreditStatus and UserProfile types, and frontend code showing useCredits hook usage patterns.

file_operations.description: Create comprehensive improvement areas documentation categorizing enhancements by priority. Critical priority: Complete admin blog management (frontend/src/pages/admin/BlogManagement.tsx shows 'Coming Soon' placeholder), forum moderation (frontend/src/pages/admin/ForumModeration.tsx), and user statistics (frontend/src/pages/admin/UserStatistics.tsx). High priority: Implement dashboard analytics (frontend/src/components/dashboard/Analytics.tsx empty), API key management (frontend/src/components/dashboard/ApiKeyManagement.tsx empty), saved tools (frontend/src/components/dashboard/SavedTools.tsx empty), and usage history (frontend/src/components/dashboard/UsageHistory.tsx empty). Medium priority: Complete gamification features including badge display (frontend/src/components/gamification/BadgeDisplay.tsx), unlock notifications (frontend/src/components/gamification/BadgeUnlockedNotification.tsx), streak counter (frontend/src/components/gamification/StreakCounter.tsx), and related hooks (frontend/src/hooks/useGamification.ts). Add onboarding tour (frontend/src/components/onboarding/OnboardingTour.tsx) and keyboard shortcuts (frontend/src/components/KeyboardShortcutsHelp.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useKeyboardShortcuts.ts). Low priority: Implement blog system (frontend/src/pages/BlogIndex.tsx, frontend/src/pages/BlogArticle.tsx, frontend/src/types/blog.ts, frontend/src/components/FeaturedBlogCards.tsx) and forum functionality (frontend/src/pages/forum/ForumIndex.tsx, frontend/src/pages/forum/ForumThread.tsx, frontend/src/pages/forum/CreateThread.tsx). Document missing backend integrations for real data in admin analytics (frontend/src/pages/admin/UsageAnalytics.tsx shows mock data alerts), quota management (frontend/src/pages/admin/QuotaManagement.tsx frontend-only state), and user management (frontend/src/pages/admin/UserManagement.tsx placeholder). List incomplete tool implementations (frontend/src/pages/tools/Analyzer2.tsx, Calculator2.tsx, Productivity2.tsx all empty). For each area, provide: current file path, code snippet showing placeholder state, explanation of what's missing, suggested implementation approach, and estimated complexity. Include actionable next steps for prioritized development.

requirements.summary: Create comprehensive documentation page for Best Practices covering guidelines for development, modifications, and consistency standards
acceptanceCriteria: Documentation page accessible at /documentation/best-practices route
Documents tool creation workflow with step-by-step guide
Explains backend constraints with code examples
Lists all immutable frontend paths with explanations why
Provides code style and consistency guidelines
Includes examples of correct vs incorrect patterns
Documents naming conventions for files, components, and functions

file_operations.description: Create comprehensive best practices documentation. Document tool creation workflow: 1) Plan tool with metadata (name, slug, category, icon from frontend/src/constants/categories.ts), 2) Create component in frontend/src/pages/tools/[category]/ following naming convention (PascalCase matching tool name), 3) Implement UI using ToolPageTemplate with tool-specific gradient hero from frontend/public/assets/generated/tool-[slug]-hero-gradient.dim_1200x400.png, 4) Add tool metadata to frontend/src/constants/tools.ts array with complete description/FAQs/about/usability, 5) Register lazy route in frontend/src/App.tsx using TanStack Router pattern, 6) Test routing, metadata display, and integration. Include workflow diagram showing these steps embedded from frontend/public/assets/generated/tool-creation-workflow.dim_1200x800.png. Document backend constraints: single-actor architecture in backend/main.mo (never create separate canisters/actors), use stable variables for persistence across upgrades, include authorization guards using Runtime.trap for unauthorized access, prefer query functions for reads and shared functions for writes. List immutable frontend paths with explanations: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts (Internet Identity integration is core infrastructure), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts (actor instantiation pattern must remain consistent), frontend/src/main.tsx (app initialization and provider setup), frontend/src/components/ui/* (shadcn/ui components maintain design system integrity). Provide code style guidelines: use TypeScript for all new files, functional components with hooks over class components, const for immutable values, descriptive variable names (isLoading not loading), organize imports (React, external libraries, internal modules, types), use Tailwind utility classes over custom CSS. Document naming conventions: components use PascalCase (ToolCard.tsx), hooks use camelCase with 'use' prefix (useCredits.ts), utilities use camelCase (formatters.ts), pages match route structure. Include correct vs incorrect pattern examples: proper React Query usage with enabled flags, authorization checking patterns, component composition over prop drilling, error boundary usage. Explain consistency standards for maintaining codebase quality.

file_operations.description: Add credit consumption sequence diagram to the credit system documentation. Alternatively, create an ASCII art diagram showing the flow: User Action → Frontend Component → useCredits Hook → Actor Method → Stable Storage → Response → Cache Update → UI Update. Include explanatory text describing each step in the credit consumption flow with emphasis on authorization checks, balance validation, and automatic cache invalidation.

Embed architecture diagrams showing technology stack layers and frontend-backend integration. Include the generated architecture diagram using the workspace file path frontend/public/assets/generated/architecture-diagram.dim_1200x800.png showing layered architecture: User Interface Layer (React + Tailwind + Shadcn UI) → State Management Layer (React Query + Context) → Integration Layer (useActor + useInternetIdentity) → Backend Layer (Motoko Actor) → Storage Layer (Stable Variables). Also embed frontend/public/assets/generated/architecture-data-flow.dim_1200x800.png showing data flow patterns. Create an ASCII art or Mermaid diagram illustrating technology interaction: Browser → React Components → React Query (cache) → useActor Hook → Internet Identity (auth) → Motoko Actor → Stable Storage. Include sections explaining how each technology layer communicates with adjacent layers and the data flow through the entire stack.

Use arrows and decision points to illustrate the workflow.
